channel.title: Regarding Port Forwarding & No-Ip! Please read
channel.description:
Alright everyone, now i've portforwarded using an ethernet cable connected to my broadband modem. I've used port checker, my port is open. I've created a No-IP, downloaded No-IP DUC, checked the box for the no-ip I want to use and entered the No-IP I want to connect to in Gui.java. *BTW I'M USING ONE COMPUTER NEXT TO ME AND THIS ONE WHICH IS HOSTING THE SERVER* When I construct, the cmd says something like: "java.net.UnknownHostException: *myNo-Ip*.no-ip.biz" and closes down quickly. When I enter my External IP address, it loads up my client and etc, but when I try to log in, it says error connecting to server on both computers.
What's going on? My idea of what's happening is that I can't host from one Connection and play on the same one. Please reply and try to help!

item.title: Regarding Port Forwarding & No-Ip! Please read

Stop spamming I need actual help here.

item.title: Regarding Port Forwarding & No-Ip! Please read
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

deathschaos9:

And you say your using a computer thats on the same network as the hosting computer?

Yes that’s what i’m saying.

-EDIT-
Is that the problem? If so, how do people who host servers play on their own server? Do they login using localhost? That could be possible since your no-ip would be your ip and if you log in on localhost it’d be logging in on your ip.

Read full topic
